website_summaries.verdict: The best choice for anyone new to DSLRs or looking for a lightweight camera – it contains all the essential DSLR features packed into a tiny package.
pros: An on-screen "feature guide" helps newbies understand the various camera modes and settings
it also connects to Android devices so you can use a phone as a remote control
cons: Integrated Wi-Fi only works with mobile devices, not PCs
The hot shoe can only be used with Canon accessories

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great starter camera. Took amazing photos on my travels to the desert and the Arches. Auto focus is great and take superb close ups. It struggles to adjust to high contrast lighting and can be slow to adjust in general. It is super well made and can survive a beating- which I found out when a dog ran away with the strap in its mouth. *oops*. Happy with this purchase overall!
customer_reviews.author: Xena

customer_reviews.title: Spots
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Rebel T7 I have bought in the last 6 or 7 weeks. The first one had a messed up sensor on it. I sent it back to Canon for repair. It came back worse than when I sent it. They wanted me to send it to them again. HA! But, I had a ton of lenses for a Canon I cannot afford to replace, so I am stuck with one. This second one has what appears to be oil spots on the photos. I am returning it and lenses or no, I am going to purchase a Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: tharzill

customer_reviews.title: Flash Hotshoe Crippled - Only Works With Canon Flash
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade to the T6 except they crippled the flash shoe by removing the universal hotshoe pin pin. (Non iso compliant) It will not work with non Canon flash or manual triggers. Canon and Amazon tech were unable to provide a solution to fire remote flashes except for optical trigger which doesn’t work when the camera body is enclosed in a photo booth head and the build in flash cannot be used. Canon said this is a stripped down version and doesn’t expect the user to require remote flash. Other than that this is a great low cost entry level DSLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Carr

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA... but...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to find out that it didn't have a microphone jack. I got this new updated camera for my youtube channel and I use a RODE mic attached to it for better sound quality.. but was very sad when I realized there's no place to plug in the mic. instead of having to order other cords or a new mic and trying to record sound a different way, I just returned the camera for a canon 77D.. definitely worth the extra $$.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I’m a beginner photographer but I started a photography Instagram page and it gives great quality photos. This is a great camera for beginners!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Honore

customer_reviews.title: Love Cannon Cameras!
customer_reviews.text: I am a life long Cannon fan. Easy to use and is a complete set with zoom. Excellent camera for beginners and experienced alike. I bought an attachable flash for myself but it does come with one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McDuffie

customer_reviews.title: If I were you, I'd save my money for a better model.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Focus ain't too great, So you gotta use the manual version. Lens that it comes with definitely ain't for long distances, And the picture quality isn't the best. This is sort of good if you need it for family gatherings and so on, Better than a phone's normal camera. But, If you want to be a photographer, I'd look into higher end stuff and save your money. It's not much better than the Powershot. Video quality is pretty good though!
customer_reviews.author: Julio Mares

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set whether you are a beginner or season veteran. The camera set is of excellent quality and ease of use. I did get the 500-1000mm lens afterwards along with some other accessory packs. This is the first canon camera i have owned. I always had Pentax and Hp camera's but I can tell you this is much nicer and once you learn the control setting is great for many types of photography including night shooting of wildlife. Love the set and think its the best quality, value set on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Batfire

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've been testing this out now for a few weeks for our online business PrimpingYourHome.com. So far I love it. My last camera never seemed to let me get items bright enough. This one lets me do things without always being in auto mode. Came with a 18-55mm lens and a 75-300mm lens. For me it was a great buy for what I needed. Yes if I didn't buy it yet I would still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is I'm having a lot of fun with this. Oh, and it gets used frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great step up when your cell phone camera doesn't cut it anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Takes great camera shots. Easy to use. Bought it for video taking and the videos turn out really well as long as you use a tripod. What I don't like is the wifi will connect to everything (other camera's, a cell phone) and even upload to the internet through your home wifi, but IT WILL NOT (Canon states this if you look hard at their website) upload to your computer through wifi? What on earth were they thinking? It doesn't come with a USB chord, either. Other than that, I have been pleased with it as it is simple to use and does have a lot of features.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Quince

customer_reviews.title: Great product.

There is just a lot of information to read and comprehend if you want a thorough understanding of the camera's abilities. For me, it is PERFECT.

customer_reviews.title: Love it

I have no serious complaints about it. I personally would have designed the UI a bit different but that's all.
